item.title: Everything You Need to Know About IT Audit: How to Optimize Your IT Infrastructure
item.description:
In today’s fast-paced technological world, businesses must stay competitive. One key tool to achieve this is an IT audit. This service evaluates your information infrastructure, identifies weaknesses, and offers ways to improve it. In this article, we’ll explain what an IT audit is, why it’s essential, and how it can benefit your company.

What is an IT Audit?

An IT audit is a comprehensive review of a company’s information systems, including hardware, software, network infrastructure, data security, and compliance with standards. The goal is to assess the efficiency of IT processes, identify risks, and provide recommendations for improvement.

item.title: Local Networks: Building, Maintenance, and IT Infrastructure Setup
item.description:
Local networks (LANs) form the backbone of modern IT infrastructure for businesses, offices, and even home users. They enable fast data exchange, stable internet access, and seamless interaction between devices. In this article, we’ll explore the key aspects of building and maintaining local networks, selecting server equipment, configuring routers, and diagnosing incidents to ensure your network runs smoothly.

What is a Local Network and Why Does It Matter?

A local network is a system that connects computers, servers, printers, and other devices within a single space, such as an office or home. It facilitates rapid data transfer, centralized resource management, and reliable internet access. A well-designed local network boosts productivity, reduces IT maintenance costs, and ensures consistent performance.
